text:
Hi all!
Is there a way to change the json of a module in the designmanager? That would be great!
<@UKHNRHVC7> just curious if you were able to find anything on this bug?  The customer reached out to me and is getting close to abandoning the child theme as it's a blocker for her.
Hey Kevin- sorry for the delay here, I was OOO yesterday. We've just pushed a fix for this issue. Let me know if you continue to see any issues here

<@UKHNRHVC7> <@U016CP4G7T7> Just a heads up that I'm still gettin reports of this CHILD-THEME BUG regarding the theme settings getting pulled over to live previews.  Customer's HubID: 19584090

<https://www.loom.com/share/43c8c46e9e0342109f4e28ae070c0b23>

Hey Kevin - sorry for not giving more detail on the original bug fix. This is the same root cause as the last bug, but something I forgot to mention with it: pulling in the fix does require all of the CSS to be re-minified and uploaded to our CDN. This can be triggered by modifying the file, or I just did it for this portal (I used the call to action button color to check for success, if there's more files I need to republish let me know). The CTA is now showing up as the correct color
We _should_ be re-minifying whenever the theme settings change though - do you know if either you or the customer edited them since May 4 when we pushed that bug fix? I'm guessing we missed a spot

hi yall! I am new to this Slack channel and I have a question about using custom fonts in a basic theme. My client has provided files which I have turned into @font-faces and uploaded to the theme/portal. My problem now is that I don't know how to add these custom fonts as options in the theming dashboard dropdowns, so I can't override the default fonts like I want to. Is there documentation or a recommended way to use custom fonts in a custom theme? I would appreciate any help or points in the right direction! Thank you in advance
UPDATE: solved my own problem by adding the font families as the defaults in the theme.json file but if anyone knows of a better way feel free to chime in
